title: Portfolio
text:
I benefited a lot from the course content of Geography 192, which taught us how to mitigate urban and environmental problems by creating mathematical models and GIS Mapping.
Here is a example from my Lab report, which exploring the spatial efficiency of existing and optimized fire facility placement strategies in Santa Barbara.


Using interactive map to determine the fire stations in SB




Constructing Mathematical Model
The objective of this model is to minimize the number of fire stations selected while no demand area will be further than the maximal service.





Optimizing and visualizing the model via Gurobi (A model optimizer)




Getting result


For more details: you can visit my other personal profile website if you are interested:
https://yicongzeng.github.io/



Reference:
Murray, Alan T., et al. “Geographic Fire Response Standards Emerging from Human-Environment Interactions.” Department of Geography, University of California at Santa Barbara, 4 Mar. 2024.

title: Yicong Zeng
text:
About me
Hi! Thanks for stopping by here. My name is Yicong Zeng, you can also call me Kevin. I’ m a third year Environmental Studies students at UCSB. I enjoy studying GIS, geomorphology, and environmental impact analysis, helping me use geographic information systems to better understand and address environmental issues.


Educational Background
B.A in Environmental Studies
University of California, Santa Barbara

title: Life
text: Here is a record of my life photos, including my hobbies and interesting things around. Hope you enjoy it!

title: About
text:
About this site
Welcome to my personal space on the internet! This site is a window into my life and academic journey as an Environmental Studies major at UCSB. Here, you’ll find a mix of personal insights and my projects that reflect my passion for environmental solutions and GIS.
Sunrise in Santa Barbara





GIS Data Layers
